name: LDAP
description: The LDAP Connector provides access for LDAP servers through a simple web services interface to do CURD (Create, Update, Read, Delete) operations on LDAP entries.

operations.name: updateEntry
operations.description: Update LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to update. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: attributes
params.description: The attributes to update for the LDAP entry, provided as key-value pairs. Example: {"mail":"john.doe@example.com","telephoneNumber"="123456789"}

params.name: mode
params.description: The update mode: ADD to add new attributes, REPLACE to overwrite existing values, or REMOVE to delete attributes.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: searchEntry
operations.description: Search LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (base DN) from where the search should begin. Example: ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: filters
params.description: Search filters in comma-separated key-value format. Example: cn=John,mail=john.doe@example.com

params.name: objectClass
params.description: The object class of the LDAP entry to search for. Example: inetOrgPerson

params.name: attributes
params.description: Attributes to include in the search result. Example: cn,sn,mail

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum number of search results to return. Use 0 for unlimited.

params.name: scope
params.description: Specifies the search depth: `base` searches only the specified entry, `one` searches its immediate children, and `sub` searches the entire subtree rooted at baseDN.

params.name: onlyOneReference
params.description: If true, ensures only one reference is returned.

params.name: allowEmptySearchResult
params.description: If true, no exception will be thrown when the search returns no result.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: deleteEntry
operations.description: Delete LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to be deleted. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: addEntry
operations.description: Add LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name of the LDAP entry to be added. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: objectClass
params.description: The object class of the LDAP entry. Example: inetOrgPerson, organizationalUnit

params.name: attributes
params.description: A set of attributes for the new LDAP entry in JSON format. Example: {"sn":"Doe", "givenName":"John", "mail":"john.doe@example.com"}

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: updateName
operations.description: Rename LDAP Entry

params.name: oldName
params.description: The current fully qualified distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: newName
params.description: The new fully qualified distinguished name (DN) for the LDAP entry. Example: cn=John Smith,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: authenticate
operations.description: Authenticate LDAP User

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to authenticate. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: password
params.description: Password of the LDAP user for authentication.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The unique name of the connection to LDAP.

params.name: secureConnection
params.description: Boolean value to enable or disable secure connection to LDAP.

params.name: disableSSLCertificateChecking
params.description: Boolean value to disable or enable SSL certificate checking for LDAP.

params.name: providerUrl
params.description: URI of the LDAP directory, e.g., ldap://<host>:<port>/

params.name: securityPrincipal
params.description: Username used to log in to LDAP.

params.name: securityCredentials
params.description: Password used to log in to LDAP.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout duration of the LDAP request in milliseconds.

params.name: connectionPoolingEnabled
params.description: Enable or disable connection pooling for LDAP.

params.name: connectionPoolingProtocol
params.description: Space-separated protocol types for connection pooling. Valid values: 'plain', 'ssl'.

params.name: connectionPoolingInitSize
params.description: Number of connections per connection identity to create initially.

params.name: connectionPoolingMaxSize
params.description: Maximum number of connections per connection identity that can be maintained concurrently.
